div.p: Sign. 630.1.1. 4, Arkivet, Svenska Litteratursällskapet i Finland, Universitetsbibliotek, Helsingfors, Finland.

Accept, dear Prof. Lindberg, my best felicitation for the new year, and let me hope that it will be to you a joyous one! It was with much sadness, that I heard of your protracted illness and the calamitous accident, which befel you. Let me hope, that you have now fully recovered, and that you may thus resume the important bryologic labours, which have rendered you already so illustrious

I write this at a midnight hour, the mail going to morrow morning, and as I have only risen from my sickbed,
M does not refer to being sick in other letters from this time. you must excuse me for not writing at length.

Do not consider yourself under any obligation to me, as long as you will kindly revise the mosses and send me a typical set from the different localities back. Should you have duplicates of any Russian, Swedish or Artic
Arctic.
mosses, they will from your hand be lastingly welcome. But do not trouble unless you happen to have them ready.

I never got the two letters to which you refer. Their loss will explain my repeated enquiries. If the mosses had been lost or gone astray, I should be blamed by the authorities here. I have neither received any prints yet about the Australian Mosses examined by you.

I am glad Dr v. d. Sande Lacoste
C. M. van der Sande Lacoste.
has consented to look over the Lichenastra.
I will get ready for your bot Garden a collection of Australian seeds during this autumn. The harvest of seeds is just commencing.
